description.narrative: Strengthened capacity for preparedness, implementation, coordination and monitoring of nutrition response targeting most vulnerable boys, girls and women in humanitarian situations, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: Infants, young children and mothers have increased and equitable use of nutritional services and improved nutrition and care practices, with a focus on stunting.

participating-org.narrative: CITY OF BULAWAYO HEALTH SERVICES DEPARTMENT
MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND CHILD CARE
ORGANIZATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH INTERVENTIONS AND DEVELOPMENT

sector.narrative: Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
Care for children with severe acute malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: Zimbabwe United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Zimbabwe 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity for preparedness, implementation, coordination and monitoring of nutrition response targeting most vulnerable boys, girls and women in humanitarian situations

Number of caregivers of children less than 2 years old who are reached messages on breastfeeding, young child feeding or healthy diets in the context of COVID through national communication campaigns [COVIDSitRep]
Children aged 6 to 59 months receiving vitamin A supplementation
In humanitarian situations: Number of children aged 6-59 months with SAM who are admitted for treatment
Percentage of health facilities with zero stock out of supplies for the management of SAM in the past 3 months as per national standards (as a proxy for SAM treatment supplies) [COVID]
